title: /login - Authenticate User
name: Login
description: This endpoint will authenticate a user in the App Movement system. After successful authentication the endpoint will return a session_key which should be used on subsequent requests when interacting with the API.

Parameter.description: Email address of the user
Password of the user (pre hashed and salted with appropriate salt)
API Key

Success 200.description: User photo of file (url needs to be constructed to request this image)
User role on site (will always be "user" unless specified otherwise)
Forgotten password code that is currently active when user performed forgotten password request
Boolean to show if user receives email updates
Latest active session key for given user

examples.title: Success-Response:

Error 4xx.description: email Email address already registered. Please sign in with your App Movement account if you have one.

examples.title: Error-Response:

title: /register - Register New User
name: Register
description: This endpoint will register a new user in the App Movement system. If a user calls this register endpoint with the same details as the initial request the user object of the currently registered user will be returned.

Parameter.description: Username of the user
Fullname of the user
Email address of the user
API Key

Success 200.description: User photo of file (url needs to be constructed to request this image)
User role on site (will always be "user" unless specified otherwise)
Forgotten password code that is currently active when user performed forgotten password request
Boolean to show if user receives email updates
Latest active session key for given user

examples.title: Success-Response:

Error 4xx.description: email Email address already registered. Please sign in with your App Movement account if you have one.

examples.title: Error-Response:

title: /reset - Reset Password
name: Reset
description: This endpoint will reset a user's password using the App Movement system. After posting, the user will receive an email with a unique link which they need to click and follow onto the App Movement forgotten password page. From here they can reset their password. The meta.success will tell you if the email has been sent successfully. There is no response object in the data object

Parameter.description: Email address of the user
App name of the app requesting the forgotten password
API Key

examples.title: Success-Response:
Error-Response:

title: /setup - Get Setup Params
name: Setup
description: This is called each time an app is loaded and will return the latest version numbers for both iOS and Android as well as any survey urls that should be presented to the user

Parameter.description: user id of current logged in user
session id of authenticated user
API Key

Success 200.description: Dynamic hashtags to be injected in share text
Survey URL of a Google Forms survey

examples.title: Success-Response:
Error-Response:

title: /share - Generate a share link
name: Share
description: This endpoint generates unique share links for any given content.

Parameter.description: user id of current logged in user
Unique id of the content you're sharing (e.g. review id)
App Identifier (e.g. movement_56_254)
The type of share action you are performing. (e.g. review, movement, venue). Pass in the string representation of the share_link_type_id
API Key

Success 200.description: Share code that needs to be appended to the url (e.g. http://app-movement.com/share/CODE)

examples.title: Success-Response:
Error-Response:

title: /version - Version check
name: Version_Check___Legacy
description:
This endpoint will display the latest version numbers for both the iOS and Android apps for the geolocation template.

This has been replaced by the /setup endpoint.

However it is required for legacy support.
The :identifier should be the movement identifier e.g. movement_42_156 found in the movement table. No api key required.

examples.title: Success-Response:

title: /add_venue - Add Venue
name: Add_Venue
description: This endpoint allows users contribute new venues. The lat/lng combination will be geocoded on the server and the address, city and country will be filled in automatically.

Parameter.description: User id of user making the request
Venue id of the review being reported
Name of new venue
Latitude of new location
Longitude of new location
Foursquare ID if added using the "Add Venue" through foursquare search
Session key of authenticated user NEEDS TO BE CHECKED
API Key NEED TO ADD THIS check NEEDS TO BE CHECKED

examples.title: Success-Response:

Error 4xx.description: Please provide venue_id NEEDS TO BE CHECKED

examples.title: Error-Response:

title: /delete - Delete Review
name: Delete
description: This endpoint allows you to mark reviews as deleted. These will be flagged and not shown when retrieved by subsequent requests.

Parameter.description: User id of user making the request
Profile user_id of the user you wish to retrieve
Session key of authenticated user
API Key NEED TO ADD THIS check NEEDS TO BE CHECKED

examples.title: Success-Response:
Error-Response:

title: /like - Like Review
name: Like
description: This endpoint allows users to "Like" a review.

Parameter.description: User id of user making the request
Venue id of the review being reported
Review id of the review being reported
Session key of authenticated user NEEDS TO BE CHECKED
API Key NEED TO ADD THIS check NEEDS TO BE CHECKED

Success 200.description: Venue id of the review being liked
Review id of the review being liked

examples.title: Success-Response:

Error 4xx.description: Please provide venue_id NEEDS TO BE CHECKED
Please provide review_id NEEDS TO BE CHECKED

examples.title: Error-Response:

title: /user_profile - User Profile
name: Profile
description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve a user profile for a given user.

Parameter.description: User id of user making the request
Profile user_id of the user you wish to retrieve
Session key of authenticated user
API Key NEED TO ADD THIS check

Success 200.description: User photo of file (url needs to be constructed to request this image)
User role on site (will always be "user" unless specified otherwise)
Forgotten password code that is currently active when user performed forgotten password request
Boolean to show if user receives email updates
Count of reviews that the user has posted
Count of likes the user has received through their reviews

examples.title: Success-Response:
Error-Response:

title: /report - Report Review
name: Report
description: This endpoint allows users to leave a freeform text report for a given review.

Parameter.description: User id of user making the request
Venue id of the review being reported
Review id of the review being reported
Free form text submitted by user to report review
Session key of authenticated user NEEDS TO BE CHECKED
API Key NEED TO ADD THIS check NEEDS TO BE CHECKED

Success 200.description: Venue id of the review being reported
Review id of the review being reported

examples.title: Success-Response:

Error 4xx.description: Please provide venue_id NEEDS TO BE CHECKED
Please provide review_id NEEDS TO BE CHECKED

examples.title: Error-Response:

title: /review - Post Review
name: Review
description: This endpoint allows the user to submit a review for a given venue. You can also send a file in the header of the request which will be used as a review image.

Parameter.description: User id of user making the request
Venue id of the venue you wish to review
q1 rating 0 - 5 for rating option A
q2 rating 0 - 5 for rating option B
q3 rating 0 - 5 for rating option C
q4 rating 0 - 5 for rating option D
Text of the review (VARCHAR 800)
Session key of authenticated user
API Key

Success 200.description: Review text of the review left by the user
Unique share link for this review, can be accessed in a web browser to see the venue and discussion online

examples.title: Success-Response:
Error-Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
{
   "meta": {
       "success": false,
       "min_version": 1,
       "session_valid": true
   },
   "errors": [
       "Please provide user_id",
       "Please provide venue_id",
       "Please provide q1",
       "Please provide q2",
       "Please provide q3",
       "Please provide q4",
       "Please provide review_text"
   ],
   "data": []
}

title: /unlike - Unlike Review
name: Unlike
description: This endpoint allows users to "Unlike" a review.

Parameter.description: User id of user making the request
Venue id of the review being liked
Review id of the review being liked
Session key of authenticated user NEEDS TO BE CHECKED
API Key NEED TO ADD THIS check NEEDS TO BE CHECKED

examples.title: Success-Response:

Error 4xx.description: Please provide venue_id NEEDS TO BE CHECKED
Please provide review_id NEEDS TO BE CHECKED

examples.title: Error-Response:

title: /venue - Get specific venue
name: Venue
description:
This endpoint returns a venue object for a given venue_id.

The venue photos are not included in this request and will be an empty array.

Parameter.description: User id of user making the request
Venue id of the venue you wish to retrieve
Session key of authenticated user
API Key

Success 200.description: User id of user who added the venue
Address line 1 (Generally street number and if possible, house number)
Address line 3, State, District of Region (e.g. Tyne and Wear)
Hide/Unhide venue from search result. This is to "remove" the venue from the map.
Count of reviews for the given venue
Q1 Average rating from all the reviews
Q2 Average rating from all the reviews
Q3 Average rating from all the reviews
Q4 Average rating from all the reviews
Array of review objects for the place (see below for the object structure)
Review text of the review left by the user
Boolean to "hide" the review from being returned
"0" or "1" to mark as deleted or not
Number of likes that the review has received
Object User object of the reviewing user
Profile photo of user (i.e. andy.png). Needs a path to be constructed in order to access this image
Object Array Array of Photo objects in the review
Name of the photo (i.e. 1283123iu.jpg) Needs a path to be constructed in order to access this image
Boolean to show if the photo has been requested from the Foursquare API
Url object containing the different sized photos available
Shows if the current user making the request has "Liked" this specific review

title: /venue_photos - Get venue photos
name: Venue_Photos
description: This endpoint returns an array of photos (with attached reviews).

Parameter.description: User id of user making the request
Venue id of the venue you wish to retrieve
Session key of authenticated user
API Key

Success 200.description: Object Array Array of Photo objects in the review
Name of the photo (i.e. 1283123iu.jpg) Needs a path to be constructed in order to access this image
Url object containing the different sized photos available
Review text of the review left by the user
Boolean to "hide" the review from being returned (Performed by admins only)
"0" or "1" to mark as deleted or not
Count of photos contributed by user NEEDS LOOKING AT
Number of likes that the review has received

examples.title: Error-Response:

title: /venues - Get nearby venues
name: Venues
description:
This endpoint provides an array of venue objects for a given latitude and longitude.

It does not provide a complete venue object and therefore you must call /venue to get the full information..

The venue photos are not included in this request and will be an empty array.

Parameter.description: User id of user making the request
Latitude of location (e.g. 54)
Longitude of location (e.g. -1.3)

Bounding box of map on screen (e.g. top_left_latitude, top_left_longitude, top_right_latitude, top_right_longitude, bottom_right_latitude, bottom_right_longitude, bottom_left_latitude, bottom_left_longitude)
Zoom level of the map on screen (e.g. 17)
Session key of authenticated user
API Key

Success 200.description: User id of user who added the venue
Address line 1 (Generally street number and if possible, house number)
Address line 3, State, District of Region (e.g. Tyne and Wear)
Hide/Unhide venue from search result. This is to "remove" the venue from the map.
Count of reviews for the given venue
Q1 Average rating from all the reviews
Q2 Average rating from all the reviews
Q3 Average rating from all the reviews
Q4 Average rating from all the reviews
Array of review objects for the place (see below for the object structure)
Review text of the review left by the user
Number of likes that the review has received
Object User object of the reviewing user
Profile photo of user (i.e. andy.png). Needs a path to be constructed in order to access this image
Object Array Array of Photo objects in the review
Name of the photo (i.e. 1283123iu.jpg) Needs a path to be constructed in order to access this image
Boolean to show if the photo has been requested from the Foursquare API
Url object containing the different sized photos available
Shows if the current user making the request has "Liked" this specific review
